titleStmt.title: Baird & Price to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4745

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville March 11th 1864
Governor Bramlett
Dear Sir
Enclosed you will find the verdict of the Jury in the case of Michil Foley & Daniel McSweeney.

Said Foley was arrested for disorderly conduct & required to find security in the sum of $200 -- for the term of 3 months that he keep the peace & he of good behavior Daniel McSweeney became his security. About one month after the bond was given Said Fooley was guilty of some light disorderly conduct his bond was adjudged forfeited, & a scifa. was issued & a trial had & a fine of $200. assessed in favor of the Comth.

The Jury felt inclined to impose a one cent fine, but could not
as a verdict of guilty would carry a fine of $200 -- The Jury very properly recommended the parties to Executive Clemency

Louisville City Ct
Commonwealth
vs
Mich Fooley & c
Sci fa
$200 --

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
12th Mch 1864
